name: Cyprus, Geography and History Quiz | Cyprus | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the capital of Cyprus (English name)?
questions.explanation:
Nicosia.

	Nicosia is the last divided capital in Europe now that the walls are down in Berlin and Belfast.

questions.text: What is the capital of Cyprus (Greek name)?
questions.explanation:
Lefkosia.

	The name comes from the Lefkon  trees in the city.

questions.text: What is the name of the UN-staffed divide across Cyprus?
questions.explanation:
Green Line.

	So-called because it was originally drawn on a map in green ink.

questions.text: Which Archbishop was the leader of Cyprus in the 1960s and 1970s?
questions.explanation:
Makarios.

	He fled to Britain in 1974 after a coup in that year.

questions.text: Which ancient goddess is associated with Cyprus?
questions.explanation:
Aphrodite.

	Aphrodite sprung fully formed from the foam according to legend. You can visit Aphrodite's Baths near the small town of Polis in NW Cyprus.

questions.text: Which Christian saint was shipwrecked off Cyprus?
questions.explanation:
Paul.

	His companion Barnabus was born and martyred at Salamis in N Cyprus.

questions.text: Which of these airports serves Cyprus?
questions.explanation:
All of them.

	Paphos and Larnaca are in the South, Ercan in the North.

questions.text: There is a Mount Olympus is in Cyprus.
questions.explanation:
True.

	It's not the only Mt. Olympus, but there is one on Cyprus!

questions.text: What is Cyprus's main mountain range called?
questions.explanation:
Troodos.

	Cyprus's second mountain range the Pentadaktylos (Besparmak in Turkish) is so called because it looks like the 5 fingers of a fist.

questions.text: What sort of food is Haloumi, often seen on Cypriot menus?
questions.explanation:
Cheese.

	Haloumi is a salty cheese made from sheep's milk.
